Package Huffman

Class FrequencyTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • Huffman.FrequencyTable

  • public final class FrequencyTable
extends java.lang.Object
    A table of symbol frequencies. Mutable and not thread-safe. Symbols values are numbered from 0 to symbolLimit−1. A frequency table is mainly used like this:
    1. Collect the frequencies of symbols in the stream that we want to compress.
    2. Build a code tree that is statically optimal for the current frequencies.

    This implementation is designed to avoid arithmetic overflow - it correctly builds an optimal code tree for any legal number of symbols (2 to Integer.MAX_VALUE), with each symbol having a legal frequency (0 to Integer.MAX_VALUE).

    See Also:
    CodeTree

    • Constructor Detail

      • FrequencyTable

        public FrequencyTable​(int[] freqs)
        Constructs a frequency table from the specified array of frequencies. The array length must be at least 2, and each value must be non-negative.
        Parameters:
        freqs - the array of frequencies
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the array is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the array length is less than 2 or any value is negative

    • Method Detail

      • getSymbolLimit

        public int getSymbolLimit​()
        Returns the number of symbols in this frequency table. The result is always at least 2.
        Returns:
        the number of symbols in this frequency table

      • get

        public int get​(int symbol)
        Returns the frequency of the specified symbol in this frequency table. The result is always non-negative.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol to query
        Returns:
        the frequency of the specified symbol
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the symbol is out of range

      • set

        public void set​(int symbol,
                int freq)
        Sets the frequency of the specified symbol in this frequency table to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol whose frequency will be modified
        freq - the frequency to set it to, which must be non-negative
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the symbol is out of range or the frequency is negative

      • increment

        public void increment​(int symbol)
        Increments the frequency of the specified symbol in this frequency table.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol whose frequency will be incremented
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the symbol is out of range
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the symbol already has the maximum allowed frequency of Integer.MAX_VALUE

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Returns a string representation of this frequency table, useful for debugging only, and the format is subject to change.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this frequency table

      • buildCodeTree

        public CodeTree buildCodeTree​()
        Returns a code tree that is optimal for the symbol frequencies in this table. The tree always contains at least 2 leaves (even if they come from symbols with 0 frequency), to avoid degenerate trees. Note that optimal trees are not unique.
        Returns:
        an optimal code tree for this frequency table
